availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James T. Bramlette (Clinton Co, KY, Son of Gov Bramlette, KY state rep, attorney, inspector general)

body.p: Clinton County, Kentucky, attorney, soldier, and politician. Clinton County native. Son of Kentucky governor Thomas E. Bramlette and Sallie Travis Bramlette. Attended Centre College in Danville, Kentucky. Admitted to the bar in 1860. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1863. Inspector general of Kentucky in 1865.

ab.bibl:
"Death of Col. Bramlette. Some Account of his Military and Political Life," Louisville Courier-Journal, 11 Feb 1872, p. 4. ProQuest Historical Newspapers.
Journal of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, (Frankfort, KY: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1865), 36.
